NOTE WELL that BigDecimal's scale operates in the opposite fashion to this method's roundingLevel -- a positive scale indicates the number of digits to use on the RIGHT of the decimal dot. roundHalfUp

public static java.math.BigDecimal roundHalfUp(java.math.BigDecimal amount,
                                               int roundingLevel)
Deprecated. Now that Java 1.5 allows negative scale, use BigDecimal.setScale(int, java.math.RoundingMode). NOTE WELL that BigDecimal's scale operates in the opposite fashion to this method's roundingLevel -- a positive scale indicates the number of digits to use on the RIGHT of the decimal dot. See the javadoc for the full details.

Rounds a BigDecimal to a roundingLevel with rounding type BigDecimal.ROUND_HALF_UP. For example, 15.45 gets rounded to 15.5 if roundingLevel is -1, and to 20 if roundingLevel is 1.

Parameters:
amount - value to be rounded
roundingLevel - exponent (base 10) of the decimal position to round to (e.g., 1 rounds to the "tens" position, 0 rounds to the nearest whole integer, -1 rounds to the "tenths" position, etc.) >>>> ORIGINAL //depot/eng/pl/carbon/stable/platform/util/src/com/guidewire/util/BigDecimalUtil.java#1 ==== THEIRS //depot/eng/pl/carbon/stable/platform/util/src/com/guidewire/util/BigDecimalUtil.java#2 ==== YOURS //devmerge_pl_carbon_upgrade/eng/pl/carbon/active/upgrade/platform/util/src/com/guidewire/util/BigDecimalUtil.java <<<<
